commitResults.messageBody:
Fix label filter not working

Filters takes the value of `label.formattedName` instead of `label.name`.

After #192, assignees of a repo without any issues or PRs
are hidden. Now, add the column to display such users
with 0 PRs and issues.

Co-authored-by: Gabriel Goh <77230723+gycgabriel@users.noreply.github.com>

Previously, label full names are separated into label name
and label category. However, this is not necessary for WATcher.

Let's remove the separation so that filters only make use
of the full name.

Previously, URLs are fixed upon repo change, hence URLs are not shareable.

Let's make the current repo visible in the URL, so that it shareable.

Furthermore, login is automated when there is such next route to be redirected to.

Column pagination arrows cause unnecessary clogs
if they are disabled.

We hide arrows on columns that only has one page.

Previously, each label only has 2 states, either selected or
not selected. However, with such design,
the feature of hiding labels can be confused
with hiding issues/PRs with the label.

We implement the three-state label filters,
so that each label can also be used to hide
issues/PRs with the label.

We implement checkboxes for status, so that
multiple types of PRs/issues can be viewed concurrently.

Currently, there are a lot of options of filters,
but there are no suggested useful preset views.

We add preset views for users to choose from,
and via a button on the header.

When there are no milestones in the repo,
the issue viewer shows nothing.

Change is made so that if there is no milestone
in the milestone service, do not apply the milestone filter.

For the preset view selection, brackets are removed
and left margin is added to increase visibility.

We hide the issue column count when there is only one page,
to make space for the issues.

Previously, multiple Github API calls causes Github
to ask users for reauthorisation, or in rare cases,
rate limit is exceeded.

We reduce the number of API calls to Github
to reduce such issues.

Hide 0 issue columns.

0 Issue columns are shown.

Hiding issues with 0 columns reduces the clutter on screen, 
creating a better user experience. 
Illogical columns such as issues that are unassigned when sorting by
pull requests are also removed inherently.

Let's add logic to hide the columns when they have no issues 
associated to them.

Couple of unused services copied from CATcher.

Unused code should be removed to simplify code base 
and improve developer experience.

Let's remove these unused services.

There are a few of unused models ported from CATcher.

Unnecessary models contributes to code clutter and hurts understandability
of code base.

Let's remove these unused models from WATcher to increase code cleanliness.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused session-fix-confirmation component in WATcher
commitResults.messageBody:
This is a component only used in CATcher.

Unnecessary components contributes to code clutter and hurts understandability
of code base.

Let's remove this unused component from WATcher to increase code cleanliness.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor certain filters into its own service (#259)
commitResults.messageBody:
Filters are observed, subscribed and emitted in many different 
components.

This makes the code base hard to understand
and adapt for filtering in future components.

Let's refactor the filters into its own centralised service.

MatSort is passed by reference into IssueDataTables,
lifted up from filter-bar component. Changes to 
MatSort are detected and handled in IssueDataTables.

MatSort reference in IssueDataTables performs the 
responsibility of a dropdown filter outside of the 
filters service.
This violates good programming practices.

Let's refactor the sort filter into the filters service.

Title filter is handled outside of filters service

This violates the responsibility of the filters service

Let's refactor the search filter to use the filters service

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor milestones to save by name (#289)
commitResults.messageBody:
We store milestones by number.

This works when filters are confined to one repo, but
doesn't make sense when saving filters across repos.

Let's refactor the milestones to save by title instead
of number

No way to keep filters when changing repos.

An option to keep the common filters will be useful for anyone
managing multiple repositories without the hassle of reapplying 
the same filters.

Let's add a checkbox to the change repo dialog allowing 
users to keep their filters.

Milestones are not saved even when filters are kept.

This is inconsistent with the meaning of keeping filters.

Let's implement keeping milestones across repos.

Filters cannot be shared to among users.

Users might want to share their current view
to others, consisting of their current filters.

Let's pull and store filters in the URL to allow
sharing of filter combinations.

The default view is custom instead of currently active.

The default view should show the most relevant information
to users. This should be the currently active preset view.

Let's change the default view to be currently active.

Quotation marks and null parameters are present for
filters saved in url.

Quotation marks are unnecessary and empty filters
can be removed from the URL in order to make it
more readable and editable by advanced users.

Let's remove null params and remove quotation marks
from the url.

commitResults.messageTitle: Show preset view only when repo is set (#355)
commitResults.messageBody:
Preset view is shown before a repo is selected.

There is no reason to show the current preset
view and might confuse users as to its purpose
when no repo is selected.

Let's hide the preset view until a repo is selected.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix top and bottom shadow of columns (#357)
commitResults.messageBody:
A few bugs exist related to column shadows. 
Top shadow is shown when there are no elements
behind header and hidden when there are.
Bottom shadow sticks to the column as a user scrolls.

These are not the intended behaviour of the shadows
to indicate presence of elements behind above or
below columns respectively.

Let's update the CSS to correspond to
appropriate shadow behaviours.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix reset of filters on label fetch (#374)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a bug where filters are reset when 
labels are fetched.

This bug can cause sudden, unprompted
changes to filters.

Let's change the filter's service behaviour
when fetching labels to stop resetting filters.

Improve activity dashboard design

The ID column in the event table is not useful for the user.

The design of the dashboard is too simple. The event table's height is
not fixed, and the expanded event details might cause the table to be
too long, which is very inconvenient.

To address this, let's hide the ID column, add some information about
the actor, fix the event table height and make it scrollable, and
implement a dialog to display event details.

The test cases for the Login Component and Session Model are outdated. 

Additionally, the Conflict Model has been removed. 

Let's refactor the test cases for the Login Component and Session Model 
and remove the test cases for the Conflict Model.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for issue paginator
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the issue paginator are outdated. 

Let's refactor the test cases for the issue paginator.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for issue sorter
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the issue sorter are outdated. 

Let's refactor the test cases for the issue sorter.

GithubLabel model's properties have been changed.

Let's refactor the github label constants.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for search filter
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the search filter are outdated. 

Let's refactor the test cases for the search filter.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove test cases for permissions service
commitResults.messageBody:
The permission service has been removed. 

Let's remove the test cases for the permission service.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove constants for DataFile and Team model
commitResults.messageBody:
DataFile and Team model are removed.

Let's remove the constants of these models.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for label service
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the label service are outdated. 

Let's refactor the test cases for the label service and
add test case for fetchLabels method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for issue model
commitResults.messageBody:
The GithubIssue constants and the test cases
for the issue model are outdated. 

Let's refactor the GithubIssue constants and the
test cases for the issue model.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for phase service
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the phase service are outdated. 

Let's refactor old test cases and add test cases for new methods.

Npm run test will break if the import statement 
for zone-testing is not at the top of test.ts file. 

Let's reorder the import statement and disable
tslint rule for test.ts file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for issue sorter (#270)
commitResults.messageBody:
The method in issue sorter has been updated.

Let's refactor the test cases to match the changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for user service (#271)
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the user service are outdated. 

Let's refactor test cases for user service.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor test cases for label filter bar component (#274)
commitResults.messageBody:
The test cases for the label filter bar component are outdated. 

Let's refactor test cases for label filter bar component

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test cases for phase service (#275)
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor and add test cases for phase service

Phase service has been updated. 

Let's refactor and add test cases to match the changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Phase Service and remove Phase (#291)
commitResults.messageBody:
The concept of "Phase" is inherited from CATcher. Instead of "Phase", 
WATcher provides different "Views" of contributions in a repository.

Let's replace "Phase" with "View".

Implement GroupBy feature to allow users to group the issues/prs
based on different criteria such as milestone, status and etc.

Let's set up the Grouping Strategy and Service.

Implement GroupBy feature to allow users to group the issues/prs
based on different criteria such as milestone, status and etc.

Let's integrate the grouping service in the components.

WATcher's default view displays issues and pull requests based solely on
their assignees. Grouping issues and pull requests based on their
associated milestones may provide another useful view for the user.

Let's implement the "Group by Milestone" feature.

With groupby parameters in the URL, users can easily share 
the current grouping by using the URL.

Let's implement initialization with URL parameters and 
the ability to set groupby parameters.

commitResults.messageTitle: Reset GroupingContextService only if "keep filter" is selected. (#324)
commitResults.messageBody:
GroupingContextService is being reset when the "keep filter" 
option is selected.

Let's check if the "keep filter" option is selected before
resetting the service.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor MilestoneGroupingStrategy to match the changes in #315 (#323)
commitResults.messageBody:
Special milestone groups are not added in the parseMilestoneData
method.

Let's add the special milestone groups to the result of the getGroups
method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update repo on back and forward navigation (#322)
commitResults.messageBody:
IssueViewer's repository is not updated when navigating back or forward
in the URL history. This will lead to inconsistency between the URL
parameters and the application state.

Let's ensure that IssueViewer's repository is updated on back and forward
navigation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Enable npm run test in GitHub Action (#325)
commitResults.messageBody:
Enabling automate testing in GitHub Actions with enhanced 
code quality of the codebase.

Let's enable automate testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Show PRs without milestone in "Currently Active"
commitResults.messageBody:
PRs without milestone requires urgent action from the user.

Let's show it in the "Currently Active" preset view.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement dropdown menu for repo change (#347)
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a dropdown menu for repository selection,
simplifying the process of switching between repositories. 

This enhancement offers users a quicker and more
intuitive method to navigate to previously visited repositories.

commitResults.messageTitle: Consider open milestone without deadline as currently active (#359)
commitResults.messageBody:
For open milestones, only those with deadlines were considered as currently
active. This led to setting a closed milestone with the latest deadline as
currently active when there is an open milestone without deadline.

Let's update the selection logic to also include open milestones
without deadlines.

commitResults.messageTitle: Prevent redirection when repo not set (#228)

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tool tip for hidden users (#307)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there is no tool tip for the Hidden Users mat-card.
It is not immediately obvious what the column is referring to.

Let's add a tool tip to make it more explanatory.

Co-authored-by: Misra Aditya <e1096355@u.nus.edu>
